title: Exploring Industrial Heritage Through Digital Storytelling

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Digital content creation project centered on local industrial heritage, offering differentiated learning activities by grade level; includes a creative task support system for 5th-grade transitional students

learning_goals: Students can express the historical and cultural significance of industrial heritage using three or more digital storytelling techniques (infographics, animation, interactive timelines).
Learners can derive five or more comparative criteria while analyzing the connection between industrial heritage and modern society and produce visual materials accordingly.
Through team-based project deliverable evaluations, 80%+ of students achieve a "moderate" or higher proficiency level in learning content application.

resources: Digital Storytelling Authoring Software (e.g., Canva, StoryboardThat)
Local Industrial Heritage Field Study Resource Package

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
